business.headline: Sebi fines Anmol Ambani Rs 1 crore for lapses in Reliance Home Finance case Sebi also fined Krishnan Gopalakrishnan, the Chief Risk Officer of Reliance Housing Finance, Rs 15 lakh.
Only 7% of F&O traders made profit in last 3 years, says Sebi studyAccording to the Sebi study, 1.13 crore retail traders in F&O markets collectively lost Rs 1.81 lakh crore during this period.

NTPC Green Energy IPO: Key takeaways from DRHP, NTPC share price targetNTPC Green Energy aims to raise Rs 10,000 crore through this public issue, which will consist solely of a fresh issue without any offer-for-sale component.
Sensex ends nearly 400 points higher, Nifty above 25,900The S&P BSE Sensex was down 384.30 points at the closing bell, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 148.10 points to settle at 25,939.05.

DotPe leaves API public, exposes sensitive data of top restaurantAccording to tweets shared by social media users, DotPe's entire API was left public, meaning anyone could access sensitive information without any authentication.
'This is India's moment': Nvidia's Jensen Huang after meeting PM Modi in USNvidia CEO Jensen Huang was one of 15 tech leaders who met with PM Modi during his visit to the United States.

KRN IPO: Key details of Rs 340 crore public issue from Rajasthan farmer's sonThe IPO of KRN Heat Exchanger is the journey of Santosh Kumar Yadav, a farmer's son from Tijara, Rajasthan, from a small town to leading a major manufacturing company.
Should you subscribe Manba Finance IPO: Check GMP, price band, detailsManba Finance IPO: The IPO is fresh issue of 1.26 crore shares and closes for subscription on September 25, 2024.
Is Warren Buffett's cash pile costing him billions in missed gains? Warren Buffett has amassed a cash reserve of about $280 billion after selling shares in companies like Apple and Bank of America.

Riding high on IPO listing gains? Here's why you should book profitsRecent IPOs have brought impressive gains, but do those initial highs really last? Investors might want to think carefully about when to cash in on their profits.

GST rate rationalisation: GOM to discuss slab, rate tweaks on September 25The meeting, which will take place in Goa, is part of the ongoing efforts to streamline and rationalise the GST structure. This panel, known as the Group of Ministers (GoM), is led by Bihar Deputy Chief Minister Samrat Chaudhary.

Cochin Shipyard, RVNL, IREDA among 7 PSU stocks in ASM framework. Details hereThe ASM framework classifies stocks based on several parameters, including price volatility and delivery percentages, aiming to encourage caution among investors.
BHEL shares gain 2% after winning Rs 6,100 crore project from NTPCAt 10:35 am, BHEL's stock was trading at Rs 271.25, reflecting a gain of 1.92%, on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).

Reliance Power shares soar 5% to upper circuit for 4th straight day. Here's whyThe rally in the company's shares follows the announcement of a board meeting scheduled for September 23, 2024, to discuss a significant fundraising proposal.

Explained: Why Vodafone Idea shares jumped nearly 9% today Vodafone Idea shares surged sharply in early trade after the company made an announcement regarding a $3.6 billion deal. Here is all you need to know.
Sensex, Nifty hit all-time highs as bulls dominate Dalal Street The S&P BSE Sensex climbed to an all-time high of 84,843.72 moments after opening, while the NSE Nifty50 rose to 25,910.35.

Netflix India being probed over visa violations, racial discrimination: ReportNetflix's former director of business and legal affairs for India, Nandini Mehta, said she was pursuing a lawsuit in the US against Netflix for alleged wrongful termination as well as racial and gender discrimination - charges the company denies.

Succession Wars: Inside Murdoch family's fight for power and control of Fox NewsThe Murdoch family, one of the most powerful media dynasties in the world, is currently engaged in a bitter battle for control of their media empire.

NPS Vatsalya: 9,705 minors sign up on Day 1. Here's how to invest for your child?The scheme, overseen by the Pension Fund Regulatory and Development Authority (PFRDA), is part of the National Pension System (NPS) and aims to help parents and guardians begin retirement savings for their children from an early age

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Badlapur rape accused shot in police custody after opening fire on copsAkshay Shinde snatched a police officer's weapon and opened fire at the cops. The officials retaliated, during which he sustained critical injuries.

182 dead in Lebanon as Israel strikes Hezbollah targets in fresh offensiveThe announcement came shortly after Israel began what it stated was a fresh round of "extensive strikes" across Lebanon and suggested that Tel Aviv was gearing up for another round of conflict.

Tried my best: Donald Trump assassination suspect wrote letter detailing plansRyan Wesley Routh, accused of attempting to assassinate Donald Trump at a Florida golf course, left behind a note expressing his intent to kill the former president. Prosecutors revealed new details, including a handwritten list of Trump's upcoming appearances, as evidence of a planned attack thwarted by the Secret Service. Routh is currently in custody, facing federal charges.

Indian women mix of submission, dominance: Laapataa Ladies Oscar citation slammedThe Film Federation of India described Indian women as people who are a "strange mix of submission and dominance" in an official document about Laapataa Ladies' Oscars entry. The citation has not gone down well with many.

Sri Lanka now delivers a political earthquake in India's neighbourhoodMarxist Anura Kumara Dissanayake has been sworn in as the new President of Sri Lanka. His election is a political earthquake as Sri Lankans have rejected entrenched parties and handed power to a non-elite for the first time. Interestingly, he gave a new direction to the JVP, which fought two armed wars against security forces.

Take credit for bringing chess to Indians' attention: Viswanathan AnandLegendary Indian chess player Viswanathan Anand said that he is proud to play his role in expanding the chess culture in India and keeping the sport relevant for many years. Anand's comments came after many credited him for setting the groundwork for India's Chess Olympiad gold medal in 2024.

Exclusive: Kiran Rao talks about Laapataa Ladies' road to Oscar finaleDirected by Kiran Rao, Laapataa Ladies is India's official entry for Oscar 2025 in the Best Foreign Film category. In an exclusive chat with India Today Digital, Rao spoke what the film's nomination means to her, husband Aamir Khan's reaction after the announcement. She also spoke about how they plan to campaign for the film, leading to the Oscar finale.

Centre's notice to a ghee supplier for Tirupati temple amid laddu row: SourcesThe Food Safety and Standards Authority of India has issued a show cause notice to AR Dairy over allegations of supplying adulterated ghee for Tirumala laddus.

Millennials and Gen Z are greying at an alarming rate. Can you reverse it?Premature greying has become a worry for both millennials and Gen Zers. In addition to modern lifestyle factors, environmental elements such as pollution are also key contributors.
India reports first case of mpox from new, fast-spreading clade 1b varietyThe patient is a 38-year-old man who had travelled from the United Arab Emirates, Kerala authorities had said last week.

Bengaluru woman's murder suspect identified, over 30 pieces of body found in fridgeKarnataka's Home Minister, G Parmeshwar, confirmed that a suspect in the Mahalakshmi murder case has been identified in West Bengal, with efforts ongoing to arrest him.

Railway staffer detained for stealing detonators, setting them off in Madhya PradeshTen detonators triggered a small explosion on a track in Madhya Pradesh, briefly halting a military train on September 18. A railway staffer has now been arrested for stealing the detonators.

More wins than loses: Tracing India's incredible Test cricket journeyNinety-two years after CK Nayudu's men played India's first Test against England at Lord's in 1932, Rohit Sharma's team achieved a historic milestone. With their victory over Bangladesh in Chennai, India now has more wins than losses in Test cricket for the first time. Let's dive into India's journey in Test cricket.

Secularism a European concept, not needed in India, says Tamil Nadu GovernorTamil Nadu Governor RN Ravi criticised the concept of secularism in India, calling it a "fraud" and a European notion not relevant to the country. He argued that secularism was wrongly introduced into the Constitution during Indira Gandhi's tenure to appease certain sections of society.
Pakistani woman dangles from crane for mid-air birthday photoshoot. Pics, videosRabeeca Khan posted pictures and videos of her photoshoot on Instagram earlier this week that went viral soon after.

Donald Trump backs IVF, Kamala Harris talks guns: Party lines shift in electionThe race between Kamala Harris and Donald Trump has blurred traditional party lines as both candidates adopt policies that appeal to the opposing party's base. Harris is focusing on gun ownership and border security, while Trump is pushing for credit card interest caps and IVF coverage.

Can vitamin C supplements lead to kidney stones?High doses of vitamin C supplements can increase the risk of developing kidney stones, particularly calcium oxalate stones, while dietary sources remain safe.

Pakistan appoints Lieutenant-General Asim Malik as new ISI chief: ReportThe reported move comes as the political role of the agency faces intense scrutiny. One former ISI chief has been arrested for supporting the political cause of jailed former prime minister Imran Khan.

Row over Nirmala Sitharaman's 'unable to cope' remark on EY employee's deathNirmala Sitharaman stated that the employee's death was due to an inability to handle workplace pressure, which drew sharp criticism from Congress, accusing the Minister of 'victim-blaming'.

Pune airport to be renamed 'Tukaram Maharaj Airport'This move aims to pay tribute to Sant Tukaram Maharaj, a prominent spiritual figure in Maharashtra's history, known for his devotional poetry and influence on the Bhakti movement.

Actor Parvati Nair on being accused of assaulting domestic help: Truth will be outA case was filed against actor Parvati Nair, who has worked in the Malayalam, Tamil and the Hindi film industry, after a domestic helper accused her of physically assaulting him. She released her first statement on the matter.

Owner of Delhi coaching centre, where 3 students drowned, gets interim bailThe owner of Rau's IAS Study Circle coaching institute in Delhi's Rajinder Nagar, where three civil service aspirants died, got interim bail on Monday.

PM only talks about 'mann ki baat', not 'kaam ki baat': Rahul Gandhi in SrinagarLeader of Opposition in Lok Sabha Rahul Gandhi took a dig at Prime Minister Narendra Modi, saying he talks about his "Mann ki Baat", not "kaam ki baat".

Will Arvind Kejriwal's gamble work in Delhi polls? Corruption allegations and lack of sympathy for Kejriwal during the general elections in Delhi indicate the AAP's "party with a difference" image has taken a beating.

Matt LeBlanc's behaviour post-Matthew Perry's death worries Friends co-starsMatt LeBlanc, famous for his role as Joey in Friends, has been worrying his former co-stars with his reclusive behaviour following Matthew Perry's death. Despite a recent public appearance, concerns remain.

Boman Irani honoured at Chicago Film Festival for directorial debut The Mehta BoysBoman Irani received the SAFA award at the Chicago South Asian Film Festival for his directorial debut, The Mehta Boys. The film, which delves into the intricate dynamics of a father-son relationship, is set to release on Prime Video.
Aamir Khan reacts to Laapataa Ladies' Oscar entryAamir Khan reacted to Laapataa Ladies' Oscar nomination. Directed by Kiran Rao, the film is produced by Khan.

The citation has not gone down well with many.

sports.headline: Ancelotti reveals desire for longer stay at Real Madrid: I love this jobCarlo Ancelotti, ahead of his 300th game with Real Madrid, expressed his desire to continue with the club, despite fans speculating if his 2026 contract expiry will also mark the end of his illustrious managerial career.

India's dominant Chess Olympiad win reminds Viswanathan Anand of Soviet teamsChess Olympiad 2024: Speaking to India Today, legendary Viswanathan Anand said he was lost for words to contextualise India's dominance in the men's section in Budapest. India won the gold medal with 21 points, four more than their nearest rivals. The women's team also scripted history by winning gold.

Gukesh favourite to clinch World Championship vs Ding Liren, hints Vishy AnandD Gukesh is the favourite to win the World Championship against Ding Liren hinted legendary Viswanathan Anand. Speaking to IndiaToday in an exclusive interview, Anand said that Gukesh is performing at a much higher level than the rest.

Shakib was 100 percent fit before Chennai Test: Bangladesh selector Bangladesh Cricket Board selector Hannan Sarkar confirmed Shakib Al Hasan was declared fully fit before the Chennai Test, despite speculations of injury. Shakib's struggles with the ball and bat raised concerns after Bangladesh's heavy defeat to India.

Barcelona injury crisis deepens with Ter Stegen set for tendon surgeryBarcelona's injury crisis deepened further after captain Marc Andre ter Stegen suffered a complete rupture of his right knee tendon on Sunday, September 22. Ter Stegen is set to have surgery before going into rehabilitation.

Billy Bowden and Suresh Raina reunite, recreate the 'crooked finger' gestureUmpire Billy Bowden shared a special picture on Instagram featuring Suresh Raina as they reunited and recreated the iconic 'crooked finger' gesture.

Bernardo takes shots at Arsenal after City stalemate: Rivalry is differentBernardo Silva took a subtle jab at Arsenal after Manchester City's intense 2-2 draw at the Etihad, calling out the club's lack of trophies compared to City and Liverpool, and suggesting Arsenal played for survival, not victory.

Watch: India celebrate Chess Olympiad 2024 triumph with iconic Rohit Sharma walkThe Indian chess team was seen celebrating their Chess Olympiad 2024 triumph in iconic style as they imitated Rohit Sharma's famous walk after India's T20 World Cup 2024 victory. Both Indian men's and women's teams created history in Budapest as they clinched gold in Budapest.

Akash Deep reflects on learnings from Jasprit Bumrah: 'God has made him different'Young India fast bowler Akash Deep reflected on his learnings from Jasprit Bumrah and called him a differently built man by God.

ICC unveils official song for the ICC Women's T20 World Cup 'Whatever it takes'The International Cricket Council (ICC) announced the official event song for the ICC Women's T20 World Cup 2024, titled 'Whatever It Takes.' The tournament will kick off from October 3.

India continue to dominate, Sri Lanka advance in World Test Championship standingsThe ICC released an updated points table of the World Test Championship standing after India and Sri Lanka's wins in their respective 1st Tests vs Bangladesh and New Zealand.

Watch: Shoaib Akhtar's lookalike Imran Muhammad from Oman D10 League goes viralA video of Shoaib Akhtar's look-alike named Imran Muhammad from the Oman D10 League has been going viral on social media.

Arsenal's Arteta expects 100 PL red cards after Trossard's sending offArsenal manager Mikel Arteta predicts 100 Premier League games will see sending off this season, following Leandro Trossard's red card in his side's 2-2 draw with Manchester City.

Jayasuriya takes five to lead Sri Lanka to 1-0 series lead vs New ZealandSri Lanka claimed a 63-run victory over New Zealand in the opening Test match in Galle, taking a 1-0 lead in the two-match series on Monday. Prabath Jayasuriya starred with a 5-wicket haul in the 63-run win.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
